intro: Eschscholzia petrophila, commonly known as the Sierra foothill poppy, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers and is typically found in rocky soils and open habitats. The plant has a short stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It blooms in the spring and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Eschscholzia petrophila is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppy species.
